column4: I have a folder in my trash that I can't delete do to permissions, when I start nautilus with root privs the trash is empty. how do I empty this?
ok. Just in case you didn't knew
ya it's odd, my trash that I access by just clicking it from the desktop chows it. But I can't find the files from the command line, or when I'm in nautilus as root.
are the files hidden? If you try ls in the terminal, it won't show them
Ya I tryed ls -a still didn't see anything in the trash
have you looked for the files in /root/.Trash and /root/.local/share/Trash ? In case they exist
No .local or .trash in my root dir
so, you can see that folder with nautilus but not with the command line? Is that right? What happens when you double in the trash icon?
oh, yeah. If it's in pen or external HD, it always go for .Trash in there, not for your home folder
I don't know. I think it depends if it's one file or several small files. It didn't took him too long to delete by accident my 50Gb music collection though :'(
too quick. It doesn't give you enough time to press cancel once you see the name of the files that are being erased
yes. And if you select to not erase the files from trash when you remove it, the folder will still be there with the files. Same thing happen with Mac
ok, ya that was my problem not knowing that the trash would be on the usb drive
